text: HRr rrcfly RTHTf qrfera5<ut Phone 91-11-25074100/2507420 (Ta 4ar7, 4ss Ya6- 37 TTGHT 47T4 Fax 91-11-25093507/2509351 Extn 2223/2318/2468/25 5 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Shipping, Road Transport & Highways) G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No. 11041/21/2002-Admn; 09.03.05 Policy Circular__Administration/Financel100/2005) (Note of CLA dated 31.01.20052 Sub: The Control of National Highways (Land & Traffic) Act; 2002 - Procedural Rules for National Highways Administration: Under the provisions of the control of National Highways (Land & Traffic) Act; 2002 the Govt: is empowered to set up Highway Administration Authorities to prevent: unauthorized   occupation of National  Highways land control of access points and regulate  traffic on National Highways as well as impose penalty for unauthorized occupation: The Highways Administration or its designated Authority would have to perform the duties imposed upon the Administration as enshrined in Section 24 to Section 27 of the Act: The stretches of National Highways entrusted to NHAI are proposed to be manned by the Regional Officers of the Ministry who will be empowered to authorize the concerned Project Directors of NHAI to exercise the power and discharge the function conferred on the Administration under the said Act. As the Govt wishes to the Act into force shortly and as the PDs are proposed to authorized by the Administration, it is necessary that the PDs are prepared well in advance to perform the new functions as would be assigned to them under the Act: Following documents are enclosed herewith:- 1 Govt. of India, MoSRT&H letter no. NH-11014/4/2004-P&M dated 28.12.2004. 2 The Control of National Highways (Land & Traffic) Act, 2002 3 Highways Administration Rules, 2004 All the Project Directors are requested to go through the provisions of the control of National Highways (Land & Traffic) Act 2002 and Highways Administration Rules, 2004 Wl " (G.P.
